intro: Eurycoma harmandiana var. thorelii, commonly known as the Bornean wild quinine tree, is a member of the Rutaceae family and is native to Southeast Asia. It is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree that typically grows in lowland and hill forest areas. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color. Its fruit is a capsule that contains several seeds, and it is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. The plant has been studied for its potential medicinal properties, though further research is needed to confirm its therapeutic applications.
